titles.title: Airline Employees Financial Assistance bill
Airline Worker Relief Act of 2002
To provide assistance to certain airline industry workers who have lost their jobs, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 10/9/2002--Introduced. Airline Worker Relief Act of 2002 - Directs the Secretary of Labor to provide adjustment assistance (similar to assistance provided to workers adversely affected by import competition under the Trade Act of 1974) to certain eligible airline workers who lost their jobs as the result of the terrorist attacks on the United States on September 11, 2001.
